result.execSummary:
The defendant Christophe M Monard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs/surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No unsupervised contact with minor children 15 years or younger.
Register as a sex offender.
Comply with any reasonable Internet restrictions deemed by Agent.
Sex offender treatment.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

dated Feb 4, 2016 from Br 3 to defendant response to Jail Inmate Communication.
Requesting to serve sentence at Waukesha County Jail
reference

Defendant Christophe M Monard in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P. Powers.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dutch interpreter Bernard Groeneveld appeared, sworn in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Powers makes statements.  Attorney Powers advises the defendant has an immigration hold on him at this time and will be deported.  Defendant makes statements. 

Defendant to remain in the Waukesha County Jail, not to be transferred until February 2, 2016 @ 5:00 pm.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Sentence of:
16 month Imprisonment (Credit - 152 days)
12 month of Initial Confinement
4 months of Extended Supervision
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Sex offender treatment
Comply with any reasonable internet restrictions deemed by agent
No unsupervised contact with minor children 15 years or younger
Register as a sex offender
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition extended supervision
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition extended supervision
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 01-29-2016 01:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christophe M Monard in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P. Powers.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dutch interpreter Bernard Groeneveld appeared by phone, sworn in.  Amended information filed in Court.  Court accepts amended information.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1 in the amended information.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1 in the amended information.  Court schedules this case for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Christophe M Monard in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P. Powers.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dutch interpreter Bernard Groeneveld appeared by phone, sworn in.  Court questions the interpreter on his credentials.  Attorney Powers makes statements requesting a plea hearing.  Court orders Attorney Powers and Attorney Suha contact the Court's legal clerk to get a plea hearing scheduled that will work for all parties including the interepter.  Both parties to send the documents to be used at the plea hearing to the interpreter.  Jury trial remains on the calendar at this time.
signed by Judge Ramirez.

Case called for the defendant's motion to dismiss the mandatory minimum penalty enhancer as unconstitutional.  Defendant Christophe M Monard in court, in custody, with attorney Mark P. Powers.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dutch Interpreter Diane Van Hoof, PHD, appeared, sworn in.  Court addresses the interpreter's abilities.  Parties make arguments.  The Court cannot find that this offense is unconstitutional in regards to the mandatory term of initial confinement.  There may be a difference in penalty for an actual sexual assult as stated.  Motion is denied.
